author: Jonathan E. Lee

review: The Apple TV MD199LL/A has two basic functions. It's an audio/video streaming device like the Roku and it's a wireless connection device between your iPad and your television - that's the "Airplay" feature.  My family has both the most recent Roku and the Apple TV. The Roku and the Apple TV have more similarities than differences. Both are compact, easy to set up, compact, have a simple menu navigation system and provide excellent streaming. Not surprisingly, the Apple TV features iTunes store rentals and purchase of music and movies and Apple Radio. The Roku doesn't have Apple Store but basically has all the competitors, Vudu, Amazon, etc.  As a device for streaming movies, I'd give the nod to the Roku.  The ace up Apple's sleeve though is the iPad connectivity. With Airplay turned on I can play whatever is on my iPad (iPad 3 in my case) on my television (projector in my case) through the Apple TV. This makes the Apple TV the perfect accessory for a home theater system. Instead of playing my ipad through it's on board speaker or headphones, I can play it through the home theater system speakers while I carry it rather than have it tied to the charging stand.  I stream a lot of Pandora, Sirius/XM and Youtube music videos. Lately I've been getting into Apple Radio also.  The audio and video quality of Airplay streamed content is great. There is some lag (latency) that makes airplay connections unsuitable for most games.  By the way, I tried playing software instruments on the iPad through using the Airplay audio. As I expected, there was too much latency, at least a full second between when I hit the notes and when the sound arrived. I didn't notice the same latency playing movies. The iPad must compensate on streamed video feeds.  I think it would be great if Apple came out with an Audio-only over airplay mode which would allow a huge reduction in latency.  We'll see if it happens.  I'm giving the Apple TV five stars, because for under $100.00, it's a very useful little box. If you have an iPad and a home theater receiver, the Apple TV will increase your enjoyment of both.
